alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Grant; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 7:09PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ROBERTSON... BRACKEN...SOUTHERN CAMPBELL...SOUTHEASTERN GRANT...SOUTHEASTERN OWEN...PENDLETON...SOUTHEASTERN CLERMONT AND WEST CENTRAL BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EST... At 708 PM EST, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Falmouth to 7 miles southeast of Owenton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Bethel, Dry Ridge, Augusta, Felicity, Brooksville, Butler, Higginsport, Morgan, Hamersville, Corinth, Moscow, Neville, Chilo, Browning Corner, Stewartsville, Elk Lake, Bradford, and Stonewall. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 159. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
